medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant and suprapubic abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began a few hours prior to presentation, characterized by right lower quadrant and suprapubic abdominal and flank pain, along with abdominal distension. The patient's appetite is intact, and she denies nausea, emesis, fevers, or chills. She reports some fatigue.
medical_history.family_history: Diabetes, colon cancer (maternal great uncles), pancreas cancer (maternal aunt), breast cancer (maternal aunt).
